Greetings to President of Botswana
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Botswana 
    Pyongyang, September 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Festus G. Mogae, president of Botswana, on Sept. 27 on the occasion of the 38th anniversary of its independence.
 The message wished the president greater success in his work for the progress and prosperity of the country and expressed the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would expand in the mutual interests of the two peoples.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to President of Trinidad and Tobago
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to President of Trinidad and Tobago 
    Pyongyang, September 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of sympathy to George Maxwell Richard, president of the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago, on Sept. 27 in connection with the strong hurricane that hit the country, causing big human and material losses.
 The message expressed deep sympathy and consolation to the president, the government and the people of Trinidad and Tobago and hoped that the government would eradicate the aftermath of the natural disaster and bring the people's living to normal at an early date.

articles.title: Greetings to Nigerian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Nigerian President
    Pyongyang, September 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a message of greeting to Olusegun Obasanjo, president of Nigeria, on the occasion of the 44th anniversary of its independence.
 We are following with pleasure the fact that under your leadership the Nigerian government and people have made great progress in the work to achieve the national unity and build independent and prospering Nigeria and exerted positive efforts for the peace and common progress of the continent as the state that chairs the African Union, the message said.    
 It wished the president greater success in his responsible work for the stability and development of the country and the regional peace and common prosperity and expressed the belief that the excellent relations of friendship and cooperation that exist between the two countries would continue to grow stronger.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Prime Minister of Barbados
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Prime Minister of Barbados
    Pyongyang, September 30 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a message of sympathy to Prime Minister of Barbados Owen Arthur.
 The message extended deep sympathy and consolation to him and the government and people of Barbados upon hearing the sad news that Barbados sustained big losses from a recent strong hurricane in the Caribbean region.    
 The message sincerely hoped that the government of Barbados would remove the aftermath of the natural disaster at the earliest and stabilize the living of the afflicted people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Greets Chinese Party and State Leaders
Greetings to Chinese Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Chinese Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, September 30 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Li Zhaoxing, minister of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China (PRC), on the occasion of its 55th founding anniversary.
 The message noted that today the fraternal Chinese people, who have covered the proud road of victory and glory over 55 years, are achieving great progress in their efforts to build a comprehensively well-off society under the leadership of the Communist Party of China headed by General Secretary Hu Jintao and its international prestige is growing day by day.    
 Expressing the belief that the DPRK-China friendly and cooperative relations would vigorously grow stronger as intended by the leaders of the two countries, the message sincerely wished the PRC prosperity and the Chinese people welfare.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Dominican Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Dominican Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, September 30 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of sympathy to Dominican Foreign Minister Carlos Morales Troncoco.
 Upon hearing the sad news that hurricane hit various parts of Dominica, causing human and material losses, I express deep sympathy and consolation to you and ,through you, to the government and people of Dominica and the people in the afflicted areas, the message said.    
 It expressed belief that the government and people of Dominica would eradicate the aftermath of the damage done by hurricane and bring the living of the people in the afflicted areas to normal at an early date.
